alert.note: Alert for Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 18 at 6:45PM MST until February 22 at 5:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM SUNDAY TO 5 PM MST MONDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 5 and 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 1 and 2 feet possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Southern Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 11 AM Sunday to 5 PM MST Monday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Monday afternoon through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible and tire chains may be required for some vehicles. Those in the backcountry should ensure they have appropriate knowledge and gear and may want to consider alternate plans. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. To see a graphical representation of the degree of stress on young livestock please visit our webpage and select Local Programs then Cold Air Advisory for Newborn Livestock.
